required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Post-Marketing Study for On Label Evaluation of the GE Vscan Ultrasound Imaging System
clinical_study.official_title: A Post-Marketing Study for On Label Evaluation of the GE Vscan Ultrasound Imaging System

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to collect data and learn more about the Vscan Ultrasound Imaging System. It is an "observational" study with no additional procedures or intervention prescribed other than using the Vscan along with a routine medical physical exam.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study requires 2 visits to OHSU.
At the first visit a cardiac physical exam will be done by a cardiologist.
At a second visit, a different cardiologist will perform an ultrasound scan (as part of your standard of care) using a Vscan Ultrasound System. The first and the second visit may be done on the same day depending upon your schedule and if it's convenient for you to stay. The total exam time for both the visits, including standard exam and the study device exam will be about 45 minutes.

primary_outcome.description: A comparison of the percentages of correct diagnosis by VSCAN and clinical exam using a McNemar test for matched pairs with ECHO used as the gold standard.

study_pop.textblock: In-patient and outpatient population of OHSU Division of Cardiovascular Medicine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years or older
- provided signed and dated informed consent and is willing to provide GE Healthcare with demographic data, cardiac medical history, information collected as part of the study
- New patients who have an echocardiogram less than 6 months and patients who will be undergoing an echocardiogram as part of their routine clinical care
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant
- less than 18 years of age.
- unwilling to provide informed Consent

group.title: Abnormal Left Ventricle Function
group.description: Subjects assessed for LV function with both VScan and a clinical examination noting an abnormality.

group.title: Normal Left Ventricle Function
group.description: Subjects assessed for LV function with both VScan and a clinical examination noting no abnormality.

group.title: Abnormal Right Ventricle Function
group.description: Subjects assessed for RV function with both VScan and a clinical examination noting an abnormality.

group.title: Normal Right Ventricle Function
group.description: Subjects assessed for RV function with both VScan and a clinical examination noting no abnormality.

group.title: Pulmonary Hypertension
group.description: Subjects assessed for Pulmonary Hypertension with both VScan and a clinical examination noting the presence of pulmonary hypertension.

group.title: No Pulmonary Hypertension
group.description: Subjects assessed for Pulmonary Hypertension with both VScan and a clinical examination noting no presence of pulmonary hypertension.

group.title: Heart Valve Disease
group.description: Subjects assessed for HVD with both VScan and a clinical examination noting the presence of HVD.

group.title: No Heart Valve Disease
group.description: Subjects assessed for HVD with both VScan and a clinical examination noting no presence of HVD.

group.title: Total for All Groups Assessed
group.description: Subjects assessed for LV function using both VScan and a clinical examination.

outcome.title: Percentage of Correct Diagnosis
outcome.description: A comparison of the percentages of correct diagnosis by VSCAN and clinical exam using a McNemar test for matched pairs with ECHO used as the gold standard.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
